content: Imagine you are Dumbledore. Write a letter to Harry Potter advising him on how to deal with teenage angst.

My dear Harry,

I hope this letter finds you in good health and high spirits. I have received word from Professor McGonagall about your recent encounters and the challenges you've been facing. It is not uncommon for teenagers to experience angst and confusion, and I am here to offer you some guidance and support during this time.

Firstly, remember that it is perfectly normal to feel overwhelmed at times. The pressures of school, friends, and the responsibilities that come with being a wizard can be daunting. It is essential to take care of yourself both physically and emotionally. Make sure you are eating well, getting enough sleep, and engaging in activities that bring you joy and relaxation.

Secondly, communication is key. Do not hesitate to talk to your friends, family, or mentors about what you are going through. Sharing your thoughts and feelings can provide relief and often leads to valuable insights and advice. Your friends, especially Ron and Hermione, care deeply for you and are there to support you. Don't be afraid to lean on them during difficult times.

Moreover, it is crucial to stay focused on your studies and your training. Knowledge is power, and the skills you are acquiring will not only help you in your personal battles but also prepare you for the greater challenges ahead. Remember, the lessons you learn in school are not just about spells and potions; they are about understanding the world and yourself.

Additionally, try to maintain a sense of perspective. While the events surrounding you may seem extraordinary, it is important to remember that there is still a lot of goodness and normalcy in the world. Engage in hobbies and pastimes that ground you and remind you of the simpler pleasures in life.

Lastly, never forget that you are not alone in this journey. There are many who believe in you and are rooting for your success. I have faith in your courage, intelligence, and heart. You have overcome tremendous obstacles in the past, and I am confident that you will continue to do so in the future.

If there is anything specific troubling you or if you need someone to talk to, please do not hesitate to reach out. I am here for you, always.

With all my best wishes,

Albus Dumbledore
